messages.title: Gridlock!
messages.content: Cambridge people are sick and tired of getting stuck in traffic. How can you plan your day when you don’t know how long it will take to get across the City? Why should our kids breathe in dangerous fumes? Now a new law, steered through Parliament by experienced Daniel Zeichner, will mean local people can take back control of our local buses. The new law gives back control of the bus services so that the operator can’t cut routes that people need.

messages.title: Victory: after 2 years, Tories finally cave in on Park & Ride charge
messages.content: Out of touch Tories impose charge. People stop using the Park & Ride, causing more congestion. Daniel Zeichner leads the 'scrap the charge' campaign. VICTORY!

messages.title: Houses are homes - not cash cows for the rich
messages.content: Rents are sky high and so are the letting agent fees each time you come to renew. Having families on tenancies that after just six months means kids can be uprooted from school. Labour will stand up for the renters. Don’t forget the Tories said, 'No!' to a Labour law saying homes should be fit for human habitation.

messages.title: Get the Tories out
messages.content: Never forget that Theresa May was part of the team that introduced the Bedroom Tax, axed 20,000 police officers, and allowed rail fares to rise by 27% - at the same time as giving a tax cut to millionaires. Whose mess? May’s mess.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A new law steered by Daniel Zeichner will give local people control over bus services to prevent operators from cutting necessary routes.
Labour will stand up for renters by controlling rents and fees. Promoting laws to ensure homes are fit for human habitation.
Successfully campaigned to scrap the Park & Ride charge imposed by the Tories, which led to more congestion.

mentions.candidate: Daniel Zeichner steered through Parliament a new law for better bus control. Daniel Zeichner leads the 'scrap the charge' campaign.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Never forget that Theresa May was part of the team that introduced the Bedroom Tax.

issues.transport: Better control of bus services to avoid route cuts.
